title: Lesson 58
paragraph: Adjectives for quality, size, and sensory description — ideal for describing objects and experiences.

words.meaning: with little or no light; not light in color
words.example: The room was dark after the lights went out.

words.meaning: extending far down from the top or surface; intense
words.example: The water becomes deep near the cliffs.
The soup was delicious and warmed us up.

words.meaning: needing effort or skill to do or understand
words.example: This math problem is difficult to solve.

words.meaning: not clean; covered with unclean matter
words.example: Your shoes are dirty from the rain.
The exercise was easy for most students.
The bottle is empty — can you refill it?

words.meaning: very large in size or quantity
words.example: The stadium was enormous and held thousands of fans.
That watch is too expensive for my budget.

words.meaning: treating people equally and without favoritism; reasonable
words.example: The judge made a fair decision.

words.meaning: moving or capable of moving at high speed
words.example: This car is very fast on the highway.

words.meaning: having a large amount of excess flesh; or rich in fat content (food)
words.example: The recipe uses fat meat for flavor.
